oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Preventing the Spread of HIV From Unprotected Sex and Intravenous Drug Use Among Black Women Through Community-Based Intervention and Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Geyen, Dashiel
Fisk-Holmes, Ingrid
Guidry, H. Mark
Beal, Janice M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There are many popular, yet erroneous, beliefs about HIV/AIDS held by some women from the Black community. Such attitudes only complicate their confusion surrounding the origin and fatality of the disease.Â
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Education Leadership Research Center, Texas A&M University
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Advancing Women in Leadership Journal; Vol. 1, No. 2 = No. 2 (1998 Winter)
